Fraxion



Fraxion is a multi-threaded fractal exploration application, mainly providing Mandelbrot/Julia-type, Newton/Raphson-type, Magnet-type, and Markus/Lyapunov-type fractals.

This document contains the API documentation for all the Fraxion (version 1.1) classes.
The application was designed for the Java 2 Platform Standard Edition 1.8.0 or higher.

See: Description

Other Packages 
Package Description
org.sm.fraxion.concurrent
Provides the mechanism for multithreaded calculations of the fractals.
org.sm.fraxion.fractals
Provides the various supported fractals.
org.sm.fraxion.fractals.util
Provides utility functions for calculating fractals.
org.sm.fraxion.gui
Provides application's GUI framework.
org.sm.fraxion.gui.dialogs
Provides various dialog boxes for the application's GUI framework.
org.sm.fraxion.gui.filters
Provides the functionality for the post-processing filters.
org.sm.fraxion.gui.util
Provides utility functions for the application's GUI framework.


Fraxion is a multi-threaded fractal exploration application, mainly providing Mandelbrot/Julia-type, Newton/Raphson-type, Magnet-type, and Markus/Lyapunov-type fractals.

This document contains the API documentation for all the Fraxion (version 1.1) classes.
The application was designed for the Java 2 Platform Standard Edition 1.8.0 or higher.

When using this application, please use the following reference:
